snippet: Many former residents return to Williamsburg, Brooklyn, for the two-day Giglio Feast, where donations are collected in exchange for bread and a 70-foot tower is hoisted aloft.
abstract: Many former residents of Williamsburg, Brooklyn, return to attend neighborhood's annual two-day Giglio Feast, century-old ritual with roots in an ancestral southern Italian village.
lead_paragraph: Many former residents return to Williamsburg, Brooklyn, for the two-day Giglio Feast, where donations are collected in exchange for bread and a 70-foot tower is hoisted aloft.

headline.main: Where No-Carb Is Now the Rule, a Century-Old Ritual of Giving Bread
headline.print_headline: Where No-Carb Is Now the Rule, a Century-Old Ritual of Giving Bread

keywords.value: Our Lady of Mount Carmel Church (Brooklyn, NY)
keywords.name: organizations
